basics.name: Jasper Van
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Jasper Van from China. He's an engineer focused on the cloud-native field. He has been working in computer programming for over 10 years, with the last 5 years in the cloud-native field. He's familiar with core technologies in the cloud-native domain, such as K8s, Istio, Argo, Knative, etc.

work.name: Li Auto Inc.
work.description: It's a leader in China's new energy vehicle market.
highlights: Developed an event platform using Knative Eventing to facilitate the adoption of Event-Driven Architecture across the organization.
Created a FaaS platform based on Fission to streamline development processes with high efficiency and ease of use.
Developed a Service Mesh platform using Istio to provide consistent service governance across various programming languages.

work.name: Beijing logicreation Information & Technology Co., Ltd
work.description: It's a content provider that offers knowledge of different subjects.
highlights: Developed internal microservice component controllers and CICD systems based on K8S and Tekton, enhancing platform stability and application build reliability.
Designed and developed the company’s internal API gateway, achieving a stress test performance of up to 250K QPS, successfully supporting the traffic demands of various large-scale company events.

Participated in the design and development of the company’s e-commerce system and several middleware projects, driving the transition from monolithic to microservices architecture, and completed the migration to a self-developed e-commerce platform for Luo Ji Si Wei.

projects.name: Kiae
projects.description: An open-source cloud platform completely based on Kubernetes and Istio. alternative to Heroku / Vercel / Railway
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
Using modern technologies such as GoogleMaps, Chrome Extension and Javascript

projects.name: ZPan
projects.description: A self-hosted cloud disk base on the cloud storage
highlights: Built by all women team of newbie programmers
